sen.j: 南の局（みなみのつぼね、永禄9年（1566年）? - 没年不詳）は、鳥取城主山名豊国の娘。
sen.e: Minami no tsubone (1566 - the year of death unknown) was a daughter of Toyokuni YAMANA, the lord of Tottori-jo Castle.
Minami no tsubone (c.1566 - the year of death unknown) was a daughter of Toyokuni YAMANA, the lord of Tottori-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: c. を補い、スペースの修正をしました。
sen.e: Minami no tsubone (c.1566 - the year of death unknown) was a daughter of Toyokuni YAMANA, the lord of Tottori-jo Castle.
She was a Hideyoshi's concubine.
She was one of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's concubines.
sen.cmt: TOYOTOMI を補いました。a→one of,concubine→concubines と修正しました。
sen.e: She was one of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's concubines.
Her name was Akane.
Her name was Akane.
Her name was Akane.

sen.j: 天正8年（1580年）5月26日、秀吉は鳥取城を攻めると見せかけ、守りの手薄だった鹿野城を攻めた。
sen.e: On July 17, 1580, Hideyoshi pretended to attack Tottori jo Castle and actually attacked Shikano-jo Castle where defenses were weak.
On July 17, 1580, Hideyoshi pretended to attack Tottori-jo Castle and actually attacked Shikano-jo Castle, which its defense was weak.
sen.cmt: Tottori jo→Tottori-jo, where defenses were→which its defense was と修正しました。カンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: On July 17, 1580, Hideyoshi pretended to attack Tottori-jo Castle and actually attacked Shikano-jo Castle, which its defense was weak.

sen.j: 当時、山名豊国は毛利氏に従属しており、鹿野城には毛利の人質として妻や娘のあかね他、重臣の森下道裕・中村春次ら家臣達二十余人が収容されていた。
sen.e: At that time, Toyokuni YAMANA was subordinate to the Mori clan, and Toyokuni's wife and a daughter, Akane and twenty other vassals including senior vassals, Michihiro Morishita and Harutsugu Nakamura were detained as hostages of the Mori clan in Shikano-jo Castle.

At that time, Toyokuni YAMANA was subordinated to the Mori clan, and Toyokuni's wife and a daughter Akane, and other vassals including senior vassals, Michihiro MORISHITA and Harutsugu NAKAMURA, more than 20 others were detained as hostages of the Mori clan in Shikano-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: subordinate→subordinated,twenty→20,Morishita→MORISHITA,Nakamura→NAKAMURA,”二十余人”という部分を修正しました。
sen.e: At that time, Toyokuni YAMANA was subordinated to the Mori clan, and Toyokuni's wife and a daughter Akane, and other vassals including senior vassals, Michihiro MORISHITA and Harutsugu NAKAMURA, more than 20 others were detained as hostages of the Mori clan in Shikano-jo Castle.

sen.j: 秀吉は鹿野城を容易に陥落させると人質を奪い、彼らを連行した後、鳥取城を包囲した。
sen.e: After Hideyoshi took control of Shikano-jo Castle easily, he took hostages and besieged Tottori-jo Castle.
Hideyoshi easily made Shikano-jo Castle to surrender,then took hostages and besieged Tottori-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: よりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi easily made Shikano-jo Castle to surrender,then took hostages and besieged Tottori-jo Castle.

sen.j: 秀吉は人質を助命する代わりに開城を迫ったが、豊国が応じなかったため、見せしめとして家臣の家族達を磔にし、一人一人処刑していった。
sen.e: Hideyoshi pressed surrender of the Castle in exchange for sparing hostages' lives, however, Toyokuni didn't accept Hideyoshi's requirement, therefore, Hideyoshi crucified the family of vassals as warning example to others, and executed them one by one.

Hideyoshi forced the capitulation in exchange for sparing the hostages' lives, however, Toyokuni didn't accept Hideyoshi's requirement, therefore, Hideyoshi crucified the famies of vassals then started to execute one by one as a warning.
sen.cmt: pressed surrender of the Castle→forced the capitulation,family→families,スペースを修正し、 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi forced the capitulation in exchange for sparing the hostages' lives, however, Toyokuni didn't accept Hideyoshi's requirement, therefore, Hideyoshi crucified the famies of vassals then started to execute one by one as a warning.

sen.j: 豊国は次々と家臣の家族達が処刑されていっても、依然として開城には応じなかった。
sen.e: Toyokuni still didn't accept the request of surrender of the castle, even though family of his vassals were executed one after the other.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Toyokuni still didn't accept the request to surrender, even though the families of his vassals started to be executed one after the other.
sen.cmt: of→to, of the castle を削除しました。family→the families,were→started to be と修正しました。
sen.e: Toyokuni still didn't accept the request to surrender, even though the families of his vassals started to be executed one after the other.

sen.j: しかし、自分の娘のあかねが磔にされると、ついに開城した。
sen.e: However, when his daughter Akane was crucified, he finally surrendered the castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, when his daughter Akane was crucified, he finally capitulated.
sen.cmt: surrendered the castle→capitulated と修正しました。
sen.e: However, when his daughter Akane was crucified, he finally capitulated.

sen.j: 秀吉はあかねの命は助けたものの、開城が遅いという事で豊国との因幡国安堵の約束を反故にし、二郡のみを与えて引き上げた。
sen.e: Although Hidiyoshi saved the life of Akane, he broke his promise of approval of a landowner of Inaba Province with Toyokuni, on ground that Toyokuni took so long to surrender.
Although Hideyoshi spared the life of Akane, he broke his promise of approval of Toyokuni as a landowner of Inaba Province on the grounds that Toyokuni took so long to surrender.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。Hidiyoshi→Hideyoshi,saved→spared と修正しました。
sen.e: Although Hideyoshi spared the life of Akane, he broke his promise of approval of Toyokuni as a landowner of Inaba Province on the grounds that Toyokuni took so long to surrender.

sen.j: その後、豊国は家臣達によって鳥取城から追放された。
sen.e: After that, Toyokuni was expelled from Tottori-jo Castle by his vassals.
After that, Toyokuni was exiled from Tottori-jo Castle by his vassals.
After that, Toyokuni was exiled from Tottori-jo Castle by his vassals.

sen.j: あかねは秀吉の側室となった。
sen.e: Akane became Hideyoshi's concubine.
Akane became a concubine of Hideyoshi.
sen.cmt: a concubine として修正しました。
sen.e: Akane became a concubine of Hideyoshi.

sen.j: 豊国は豊臣秀吉に従う事になり、天正9年（1581年）の第二次鳥取城攻めに加わった。
sen.e: Toyokuni came to obey Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and joined the second Siege of Tottori-jo Castle in 1581.
Toyokuni came to obey Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and joined the second Siege of Tottori-jo Castle in 1581.
